drinkName.name: Chambord Mimosa
drinkName.about: Toast the morning with this cocktail.

mix.how: Add the Chambord and orange juice to a flute.
Top with Champagne and garnish with fresh raspberries if desired.

drinkName.name: La Fleur de Paradis
drinkName.about: Mix up this gin, citrus juice, St-Germain elderflower liqueur and Champagne cocktail for a taste of paradise.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with an edible pansy if desired.

drinkName.name: Ketel One Vodka Martini
drinkName.about: Face it: The Mad Men crew is cooler than you are. Take a step in the right direction with this classic. If you favor a vodka-based Martini, why not fill yours with a spirit boasting a rich, centuries-old legacy? The Nolet family has been distilling spirits in the Netherlands since 1691, which means Ketel One is the ideal partner for dry vermouth in a classic Vodka Martini.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or olives.

drinkName.name: Beefeater French 75
drinkName.about: This bubbly, gin and lemon cocktail will have you saying “oui.”

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a flute.
Top with Champagne and garnish with Maraschino cherries.

drinkName.name: Sunset Gold
drinkName.about: The cocktail is Sweden’s gift to you.

ingredients.ingredient: Mint syrup (simple syrup flavored with torn mint leaves)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass, fill with crushed ice and stir.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Cardamom & Pop Punch
drinkName.about: Spice up your night with this complex cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Flor de Caña 7-Year-Old Grand Reserve Rum

mix.how: In a shaker, dissolve the sugar cubes in 1 ounce of the club soda.
Add the cardamom and muddle.
Add the rum, lime juice, grapefruit juice and bitters, one at a time, while stirring.
Fill with ice and stir.
Strain into a cocktail or punch glass and top with the remaining 2 ounces of club soda.
Garnish with lime wheels.

drinkName.name: Hanky Panky
drinkName.about: Try this sultry cocktail invented at London’s Savoy hotel.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Stoli Bloody Mary
drinkName.about: You decide exactly how to season this brunch-time classic.

mix.how: Add the vodka, tomato juice, lemon juice and horseradish to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Add Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, salt and pepper to taste.
Stir gently and garnish with celery and olives.

drinkName.name: Side by Sidecar
drinkName.about: Try this pomegranate variation on the classic.

mix.how: Moisten the rim of a chilled Martini glass and coat it with sugar.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Bowery Orchard
drinkName.about: With apple juice and Tennessee whiskey, this orchard is one you’ll want to visit over and over.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Bulleit Sazerac
drinkName.about: Sambuca instead of the traditional absinthe makes this an Italian twist on the New Orleans favorite.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass.

drinkName.name: VeeV Eco Mojito
drinkName.about: Make the Cuban classic with a carbon-neutral spirit.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lime and mint.
Add the VeeV and fill with ice.
Shake well and pour (unstrained) into an Old Fashioned glass.
Top with club soda and garnish with a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Start Me Up!
drinkName.about: Nothing like a little gin to rev your engine.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger ale to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger ale and garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Barbados Rum Punch
drinkName.about: An island paradise right in your glass.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich simple syrup (2 parts sugar, 1 part water)
Aged Barbados rum, such as Mount Gay

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg and a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Spiced Chocolate
drinkName.about: Red peppers. Chocolate liqueur. Tequila. Your tongue will dance.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the whipped cream to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled old fashioned glass.
Layer the top of the cocktail with a dollop of whipped cream and garnish with a large pinch of crushed red pepper.

drinkName.name: Perfect Storm
drinkName.about: Try this orange-liqueur spin on the classic Dark & Stormy.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger beer to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the ginger beer and swirl.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: 24 Martini
drinkName.about: Try Dan Warner’s simple but elegant Beefeater 24 Gin Martini.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Deshler
drinkName.about: Enjoy your favorite rye whiskey in this Dubonnet and Cointreau drink from Brian Miller.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Cable Car
drinkName.about: Try this modern San Francisco classic.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Stir together the cinnamon and sugar in a wide-mouthed bowl or on a saucer.
Rub the rim of a chilled cocktail glass with the lemon wedge and dip in the cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat.
Set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass and garnish with an orange spiral.

drinkName.name: Harvey Wallbanger
drinkName.about: The Harvey Wallbanger is a modern classic that combines a Screwdriver with the Italian liqueur Galliano. Reportedly born in the 50s, the cocktail was a hit in the 1970s. Recently, Galliano converted back to their original recipe so try this drink today if you want to relive the golden days of disco.

mix.how: Add the vodka and the orange juice to a tall glass over ice and stir.
Float the Galliano on top.
Garnish with an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Everest
drinkName.about: Next time you say you’ve conquered Everest, you technically won’t be lying.

mix.how: Stir together the cream of coconut and curry powder to make a paste.
Add the paste and the remaining ingredients to a shaker.
Fill with ice and shake vigorously.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a sprinkle of additional curry powder.

drinkName.name: Cherry Bomb
drinkName.about: This easy, fruity and bubbly cocktail will blow you away. It combines the Brazilian sugarcane liquor cachaça with a sweet and tart cherry liqueur. Try the recipe for the Cherry Bomb below.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a lime wheel and a cherry.

drinkName.name: Sans-Culottes
drinkName.about: This fresh, summery punch could have cooled the flames of the French Revolution.

mix.how: In a punch bowl, crush the blueberries and a splash of simple syrup.
Add the remaining ingredients except the pomegranate soda, plus plenty of ice.
Stir well and top gently with the pomegranate soda.
Garnish with lemon and lime wheels.

drinkName.name: Campari Sparkling Passion
drinkName.about: Start celebrating the holidays early with this prosecco cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an ice-cold flute.
Garnish with raspberries, orange and fresh mint on a toothpick.

drinkName.name: Campari Açaí Brunch Punch
drinkName.about: Get your morning off to the right start with this drink from Ted Allen.

ingredients.ingredient: Tangerine juice or orange juice (no pulp)

mix.how: The night before serving, stir together 8 ounces each of the tangerine and cranberry juices and divide between 2 small, uncovered food-storage containers.
Place 3 basil sprigs in each container and freeze overnight.
Pop the frozen juices out of their containers and place in a half-gallon pitcher.
Add the remaining 8 ounces each of tangerine and cranberry juices, along with the açai juice, rum or vodka and Campari.
(If you can't find açaí juice, substitute extra cranberry or tangerine juice.) Stir, and garnish with lime, orange and lemon wheels.
Serve in tall glasses filled with ice.

drinkName.name: Pama Party Punch
drinkName.about: This tart, fruity and fizzy recipe makes about a gallon of punch.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the ginger ale to a bowl or pitcher and refrigerate until cold.
Pour the mixture into a large punch bowl and fill with ice.
Gently stir in the ginger ale and garnish with orange, lemon and lime slices.

drinkName.name: Knob Creek Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: This potent bourbon cocktail is surprisingly sweet.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich simple syrup (two parts sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Montford Spritz
drinkName.about: This gin-and-Champagne cocktail is the perfect aperitif.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a wine glass and fill with ice.
Stir until cold.
Top with Champagne and garnish with a grapefruit twist.

drinkName.name: Firecracker
drinkName.about: Start your celebration with this spicy cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Flor de Caña Grand Reserve 7-year-old rum

mix.how: In a mixing glass, muddle the watermelon.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Stir, and pour (unstrained) into a cocktail or Margarita glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Greenpoint
drinkName.about: As hip as the Brooklyn neighborhood for which it’s named. The Greenpoint is variation on the Brooklyn, which was spawned from a classic Manhattan. Created at NYC’s legendary Milk & Honey, it was named after the Greenpoint neighborhood of Brooklyn and the greenish hue of the Chartreuse used to make it.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Midnight Martinez
drinkName.about: You can mix up this simple-but-sophisticated drink at any time of night.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Cherry Noir Flavored Vodka
Noilly Prat Rouge Vermouth (or other sweet vermouth)

mix.how: Add the vodka and vermouth to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Squeeze the orange peel over the drink and discard.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Mary Pickford
drinkName.about: Sweet but with a real kick, just like its namesake.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: VeeV Marguerite
drinkName.about: As sweet as she is tart.

ingredients.ingredient: Raspberry syrup or maraschino liqueur or grenadine

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake until a frost forms and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

drinkName.name: Jalisco Express
drinkName.about: Climb aboard a tequila and espresso delight.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (one part agave nectar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Martini glass.
Float an espresso-roast coffee bean on top of the drink.

drinkName.name: Bellini
drinkName.about: This sparkling classic got its start at Venice’s famed Harry’s Bar.

mix.how: Add the peach purée to a Champagne flute and fill with prosecco.
Garnish with a peach slice.

drinkName.name: Summerlin
drinkName.about: Watermelon juice should be a more common part of your summer cocktails. Start here.

mix.how: Place one large ice cube into an old fashioned glass and add all the ingredients.
Stir well and garnish with a pinch of cracked black pepper and a small edible orchid.

drinkName.name: Wild Turkey Sparkling Tea
drinkName.about: An ideal summer punch for your next backyard barbecue.

ingredients.ingredient: Red herbal tea bags (lemon zinger or hibiscus)

mix.how: In a large saucepan, boil 2 cups of the water.
Remove from the heat and add the tea bags.
Steep for 10 minutes and then discard the tea bags.
Add the remaining 2 cups of water.
Stir in the Wild Turkey American Honey, transfer to a pitcher and chill.
Just before serving, add the lemon juice and club soda.
Pour the drink into tall glasses filled with ice.
Garnish each glass with a couple cherries.

drinkName.name: Cherry Collins
drinkName.about: The classic Collins gets a black-cherry makeover.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Cherry Noir Flavored Vodka

mix.how: Add the vodka, lemon juice and simple syrup to a highball glass filled with ice.
Fill with club soda and garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Snap, Crackle, Drop
drinkName.about: The classic tequila shot gets a master mixologist’s upgrade.

mix.how: Pour the tequila into a shot glass.
Stir together the bitters and pepper on a saucer until they form a paste and coat one side of the lime wedge with the mixture.
Take a bite of the lime and then sip the spirit.

drinkName.name: Bulleit Perfect Manhattan
drinkName.about: It’s the combo of sweet and dry vermouths that makes this classic perfect. Bulleit’s unorthodox twist on the old-school Manhattan? The use of both dry and sweet vermouth, in addition to a dash of potent blood orange bitters in place of the usual Angostura. The result is a doubly aromatic, complex take on the classic.

mix.how: Add the rye and both vermouths to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the bitters and garnish with a Maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: Bloody Roman
drinkName.about: Celebrity chef Chris Cosentino begins brunch with this spicy, beer-based, oyster-topped culinary concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: Castelvetrano or other mild green olives
Oysters (preferably Kumamato or Kusshi), shucked, liquor reserved

mix.how: Place 2 olives in each of 6 pint glasses.
Pour half a bottle of beer into each glass and top with the Roman Mix, divided evenly among the glasses.
Place 2 shucked oysters with their liquor in each glass and garnish with an additional olive, a serrano chile and a few chile threads.

drinkName.name: Cuba Libre
drinkName.about: It doesn’t get any simpler than a Rum & Coke with lime.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Euro
drinkName.about: Go on a Continental tour with Irish whiskey, French vermouth and Spanish sherry.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a piece of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Sandeman Ciderhouse Sangria
drinkName.about: Throw an autumn party with this port, cider and rye concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: Granny Smith apples, cored and sliced

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a pitcher and refrigerate for at least 12 hours.
Serve in tumblers, garnished with apple or pear slices.

drinkName.name: The Lone Ranger
drinkName.about: Mix up this tequila-and-sparkling-wine sipper and relax on a sunny spring day.

ingredients.ingredient: Rich simple syrup (two parts sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add the tequila, lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker.
Fill with ice and shake.
Open the shaker and add the sparkling wine, then strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: 1792 Kentucky White Dog Julep
drinkName.about: In honor of the state’s 220th anniversary, Liquor.com advisory board member David Wondrich created this refreshing Bluegrass tipple.

mix.how: Add the sugar and water to a highball glass and stir until the sugar has completely dissolved.
Add the mint leaves and press lightly with a muddler.
Pack the glass with finely cracked ice (wrap cubes in a towel and bash the bejeezus out of them with something hard and heavy) and then add the whiskey.
Stir, add more ice to make up for any shrinkage and garnish with two or three sprigs of mint and a straw.

drinkName.name: Kirsch au Café
drinkName.about: Cherry brandy and espresso come together beautifully.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the espresso to a shaker and shake (without ice) until frothy.
Fill with ice and add the espresso.
Shake well and strain into two small cocktail glasses.

drinkName.name: ZaCava
drinkName.about: It’s sparkly and sweet, and packs a rum punch.

mix.how: Add the rum, sugar cube and bitters to a Champagne flute.
Fill with Cava.

drinkName.name: Cape Codder
drinkName.about: Pretend like you’re on your yacht when you mix this one up.

mix.how: Add the vodka to a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with cranberry juice and stir until chilled.
Squeeze the lime wedge over the glass and drop it into the drink.

drinkName.name: “Dirty Martini”
drinkName.about: It may look like one, but this sweet concoction is anything but a Martini.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with an olive.

drinkName.name: Spazerac
drinkName.about: Try this unusual frozen spin on the classic Sazerac.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender with just under 1 cup of ice.
Blend until smooth and pour into an Old Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Maxwell
drinkName.about: This refreshing Champagne cocktail is perfect for a date—the recipe makes a pair of drinks.

ingredients.ingredient: Brut Champagne or other sparkling wine (about 1 split bottle)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a large shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well for 10 seconds and double-strain into two flutes.
Top each with Champagne and chill the rest of the bottle in an ice bucket.
While drinking, top with more Champagne as needed.

drinkName.name: Fish House Punch
drinkName.about: The recipe for this classic Philadelphia tipple is at least 200 years old.

ingredients.ingredient: Smith & Cross Traditional Jamaica Rum (or other strong, pungent Jamaican )

mix.how: At least a day ahead, fill a 2-quart bowl with water and freeze until completely solid.
In a large punch bowl, muddle the lemon peels and sugar.
Let the mixture stand for at least 3 hours.
Add the boiling water, stirring until as much as possible of the sugar has dissolved.
Add the remaining ingredients and stir to combine.
To serve, add the ice block and garnish liberally with freshly grated nutmeg.
This recipe serves 25.

drinkName.name: Bacchanalian
drinkName.about: New Orleans mixologist Chris Hannah makes this cognac-and-merlot concoction for Mardi Gras celebrations.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a wine glass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: Bloody Caesar
drinkName.about: This clam-juice-spiked Bloody Mary is the national cocktail of Canada.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a tall glass with celery salt, fill with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass with ice.
Pour back and forth into another mixing glass a few times to mix.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a celery stalk.

drinkName.name: Nueva Playa del Sur
drinkName.about: This elegant, bubbly rum cocktail is good for the beach or the ballroom.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Champagne to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe or cocktail glass.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Black Pepper Gibson
drinkName.about: The black-pepper-and-onion garnish makes this classic drink a savory delight.

mix.how: Rinse a Martini glass with vermouth and set aside.
Add the vodka to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with cocktail onions and freshly cracked black pepper.

drinkName.name: Swedish Mule
drinkName.about: A unique potato vodka makes this version of the classic Moscow Mule distinctive.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a Collins glass filled with ice and stir to combine.

drinkName.name: Martha Washington Punch
drinkName.about: Try the first First Lady’s famous rum-and-citrus drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a pitcher or other container and stir to combine.
Refrigerate until cold.
Place a large ice block into a punch bowl (or fill halfway with large ice cubes).
Add the prepared mixture and the club soda, and stir.
Garnish with lemon and orange half-wheels and grated nutmeg.

drinkName.name: Jane Russell
drinkName.about: This voluptuous rye-based cocktail packs a wallop.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: Black Cherry Cola
drinkName.about: The soda fountain just grew up.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Cherry Noir Flavored Vodka

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice.
Stir briefly and garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Old Fashioned
drinkName.about: The Old Fashioned cocktail is old-school but never out of fashion.

ingredients.ingredient: George Dickel No. 12 Tennessee Whisky (or any American Whiskey)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass.
Muddle to break down the sugar and stir briefly.
Fill with ice, stir again and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Twist slices of lemon and orange peel over the drink and drop them in.

drinkName.name: Ricard (Traditional Serve)
drinkName.about: Enjoy the “milk of Marseille” the traditional French way.

mix.how: Add the Ricard Pastis (and grenadine, if desired) to a highball glass and pour in thewater.
Fill with ice and stir.

drinkName.name: Becharita
drinkName.about: Introduce yourself to the complex Czech herbal liqueur Becherovka with this sweet-and-sour delight.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highballglass filled with fresh ice.

drinkName.name: The Treasure Margarita
drinkName.about: It doesn’t get much simpler than this easy take on the classic.

ingredients.ingredient: Homemade Margarita mix (three parts sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Rub the rim of a Margarita glass with the lime wedge and then dip in salt to coat.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Honey Berry Sling
drinkName.about: This sweet-and-tart creation will set you abuzz.

mix.how: Fill a highball glass with ice and squeeze the lime wedge into the glass.
Add the vodka and liqueur, and top with the cranberry juice.
Stir, and garnish with the squeezed lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Tully-Tini
drinkName.about: Irish whiskey is the backbone of this sweet-and-tart cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with an apple slice.

drinkName.name: Batida Rosa
drinkName.about: This simple but delicious creation is packed with fruit flavor.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a wine glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the club soda and garnish with an orange peel.

drinkName.name: The Original Sazerac
drinkName.about: Before it called for rye whiskey, the New Orleans classic was made with cognac.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled Old Fashioned glass with the absinthe, fill with crushed ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir.
Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass and strain the drink into it.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Guava Rose
drinkName.about: This blended drink goes exotic, with cachaça, guava and rose syrup.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a blender and blend for about 30 seconds.
Serve in a coupe glass.
Garnish with a rose petal.

drinkName.name: Piña Perfection
drinkName.about: Pineapple, tequila and rosemary collide in this fresh, complex drink.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the rosemary.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh rosemary.

drinkName.name: Cherry Moon
drinkName.about: This bubbly tipple will light up your night.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Cherry Noir Flavored Vodka

mix.how: Fill a rocks glass with ice and add the vodka.
Add the soda and top with the grenadine.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: Queen Elizabeth
drinkName.about: This early post-Prohibition concoction from Philadelphia is named for its creator’s wife, not the monarch.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinkName.name: Green Beast
drinkName.about: Make a big bowl of this refreshing absinthe and lime punch.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a Collins glass filled with ice.
Garnish with cucumber slices and stir.
(This recipe can be multiplied to fill a large punch bowl.).

drinkName.name: Yellow Bird
drinkName.about: You don’t need to be Audubon to appreciate this tasty cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel or a slice of lime peel.

drinkName.name: Golden Cadillac
drinkName.about: You’ll be king of the road when mix up this creamy classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with chocolate shavings if desired.

drinkName.name: Le Citron Caipiroska
drinkName.about: Love citrus? Try this sweet-and-sour recipe.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Le Citron Flavored Vodka

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lime and simple syrup or sugar.
Add the vodka and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass.
Top with a splash of club soda and add additional ice if needed.

drinkName.name: L’Orange White Cosmo
drinkName.about: The enduring classic, without the pink hue.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a slice of orange peel.

drinkName.name: La Poire Peartini
drinkName.about: Pear vodka and Disaronno make an elegant treat.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose La Poire flavored vodka

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with a pear slice.

drinkName.name: Grey Goose Classic Martini
drinkName.about: Ignore James Bond’s famous instructions and stir this vodka-based Martini instead of shaking. As British author W. Somerset Maugham once stated, “Martinis should always be stirred, not shaken, so that the molecules lie sensuously one on top of the other.” Wise words for gin and vodka Martinis alike.

mix.how: Fill a mixing glass with ice and add the vermouth.
Stir to coat the ice and strain, discarding the excess vermouth.
Add the vodka and bitters if desired, and stir well.
Strain into a chilled Martini glass and garnish with an olive or lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Fresh Berry Delicious
drinkName.about: With muddled strawberries, honey and a couple complex liqueurs, this drink delivers on its name.

ingredients.ingredient: Honey syrup (one part honey, one part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberries.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake very well and double strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with half a strawberry.

drinkName.name: Margaritas by the Pitcher
drinkName.about: Make a roomful of people happy all at once.

ingredients.ingredient:
Tequila
Try it with Altos Plata

mix.how: For this recipe, you need a 52-ounce pitcher.
In a 52-ounce pitcher, add the lime juice, then the Cointreau.
Adjust the sweetness with a little agave syrup (2 parts agave nectar, 1 part water) or simple syrup (1 part sugar, 1 part water).
Add the tequila and taste.
The mixture should still be intense because you haven't added any ice yet.
To serve, pour 3 oz of the mixture into a shaker with ice and shake.
Srain into a stemmed Margarita glass with a half-salted rim or a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a thin lime wheel.
If you have a large shaker or a gallon jar with a screw-top, you can shake a whole bunch of drinks at the same time.

drinkName.about: Featuring a delicious grapefruit-lavender cordial, this drink highlights gin’s floral character.

mix.how: Mist a frozen cocktail glass with pastis and set aside.
Add the gin, Grapefruit-Lavender Cordial, Lillet and bitters to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the prepared glass.
Twist the lemon peel over the drink to extract its oils and discard.
Garnish with a swatch of lemon peel and a lavender sprig on a cocktail pick.

drinkName.name: Cherry Lane
drinkName.about: This fruity cocktail is sweet, sour and complex.

ingredients.ingredient: Grey Goose Cherry Noir Flavored Vodka

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Garnish with cherries on a cocktail pick.

drinkName.name: Dutch Negroni
drinkName.about: Dutch genever makes an intriguing version of this classic Italian aperitif.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a large piece of orange zest or an orange half-wheel.

drinkName.name: Hearts of Pom
drinkName.about: Sweet-and-tart pomegranate is the ideal addition to this Margarita variation.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with a few pomegranate arils if desired.

drinkName.name: Comanche Club
drinkName.about: What do you get when you combine a Negroni and a Last Word? This unexpectedly delicious concoction.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine strain into a coupe glass.
Twist a slice of orange peel over the drink to express its oils and discard.

drinkName.name: Oceanus Cocktail
drinkName.about: Swap the vermouth in a Martini for sherry and you’ll get this simple but delicious drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail or rocks glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist and an olive or other pickled vegetable.

drinkName.name: The Pale Rider
drinkName.about: A unique combination of gin, vermouth, sherry, absinthe and a French thyme liqueur.

mix.how: Rinse a small coupe glass with absinthe and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir for 30 seconds and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a slice of lemon peel.

drinkName.name: The Foghorn Cocktail
drinkName.about: This gin drink will help guide your night.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: 75 & Sunny
drinkName.about: Created by a star Los Angeles bartender, this unusual cocktail will transport you to Southern California.

ingredients.ingredient: Dr. Adam Elmegirab's Dandelion & Burdock Bitters

mix.how: Coat the tarragon sprigs in Chartreuse and heat carefully over an open flame for about 15 seconds each.
Set one �"smoked�" tarragon sprig aside and muddle the second in a shaker with the Honeydew Honey Syrup.
Add the gin, lemon juice, bitters and 2 tsp.
Yellow Chartreuse, and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and fine-strain into a fluted pilsner glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with the reserved �"smoked�" tarragon sprig.

drinkName.name: Medicinal Courage
drinkName.about: It’ll cure what ails you.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the gin, lemon juice and rosemary.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and fine-strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

drinkName.name: Plymouth Harvest Margherita
drinkName.about: Try this gin-based, Italian-flavored concoction at your next brunch.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the tomatoes and basil.
Add the remaining ingredients except the club soda and fill with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the club soda and garnish with a basil leaf wrapped around a grape tomato on a cocktail pick.

drinkName.name: The Cappa
drinkName.about: Try this drink named for the black cloaks worn by Dominican friars.

ingredients.ingredient: Pierre Ferrand Pineau des Charentes Selection

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a small wine or cocktail glass.
Twist a slice of lemon peel over the drink and use as garnish.

drinkName.name: Speedwell Cooler
drinkName.about: Get refreshed with this complex gin-based tipple.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a strip of cucumber peel.

drinkName.name: Plymouth Duff
drinkName.about: This drink proves that gin and beer play well together.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the pale ale to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the pale ale and garnish with a long strip of lemon peel and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Tender Nob
drinkName.about: Cognac, rye, a couple complex liqueurs and walnut orgeat combine in this extravagant cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a rocks glass containing one large ice cube.
Garnish with an orange twist and a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Prince’s Pimms
drinkName.about: Address this Champagne cocktail as “Your Highness.”

mix.how: Add the Pimms to a highball glass filled with ice and top with Champagne.
Garnish with cucumber slices and a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Black Demure
drinkName.about: With a slug of spicy bourbon, this blackberry cocktail isn’t as demure as she looks.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a blackberry and lemon wheel.
